citations.narrative:
Two enclosures have an area by the floor drain that have metal corners that were sharp that dogs could touch. These
corners had been covered but the dogs have chewed the covers off in the past. Sharp edges could cause injury. Ensure
that enclosures don't have any sharp points or edges that could injure dogs.

The facility has an attending veterinarian (AV), a signed program of veterinary care (PVC) however the vaccine and
deworming schedule and preventive care schedule have not been written as part of the PVC and formally approved by
the AV in writing. Written AV approval for the vaccine schedules and preventive care helps ensure the schedules being
followed are adequate to maintain the health of the dogs at the facility. Ensure to work with the AV to review and maintain
written preventive care schedules that are approved by attending veterinarian.
This is a first Re-License Inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by 9/29/2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.6(a)(2)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Two enclosures have an area by the floor drain that have metal corners that were sharp that dogs could touch. These 
corners had been covered but the dogs have chewed the covers off in the past. Sharp edges could cause injury. Ensure 
that enclosures don't have any sharp points or edges that could injure dogs. 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility has an attending veterinarian (AV), a signed program of veterinary care (PVC) however the vaccine and 
deworming schedule and preventive care schedule have not been written as part of the PVC and formally approved by 
the AV in writing. Written AV approval for the vaccine schedules and preventive care helps ensure the schedules being 
followed are adequate to maintain the health of the dogs at the facility. Ensure to work with the AV to review and maintain 
written preventive care schedules that are approved by attending veterinarian. 
 
This is a first Re-License Inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by 9/29/2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and 
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
